meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of phosphoric acid esters
meanings.sent1: Phosphatases help break down phosphoric acid esters in cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phosphatases to understand how cells process nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The phosphatases at work in the cell were like tiny cleaners, tidying up the mess.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was a phosphatase, removing obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The phosphatases acted like little scissors, cutting the phosphoric acid esters apart.

meanings.definition: Proteins that remove phosphate groups from other molecules
meanings.sent1: Cells use phosphatases to take away phosphate groups from molecules.
meanings.sent2: The body relies on phosphatases to regulate important chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The phosphatases in the cell were like diligent cleaners, scrubbing off phosphate groups.
meanings.sent4: His advice acted as a phosphatase, stripping away the unnecessary details.
meanings.sent5: The phosphatases were like little erasers, wiping out the phosphate groups from molecules.
